title: Unpopular Opinion: Elementalist Lux doesn't fit the character
body:
I've always seen Lux as everyone's lovable, cheerful, upbeat and happy-go-lucky light mage that never hesitates to remind us to stay positive and focus on the game. Her tone of voice is always slightly giddy and she never sounds too serious.

Elementalist Lux is a great skin, don't get me wrong. Riot did an absolutely superb job working on it and it's definitely the best skin to come out yet. However, nothing about the skin screams "Lux" to me. She looks like a different character entirely, especially her face in the character icons which when compared with her original splash look like someone else entirely. It's actually somewhat difficult to identify her as Lux at first glance. I know ultimate skins are supposed to be a total overhaul of the character, but you can look at all the other ultimate skins and immediately tell what character they're for; the same can't necessarily be said about Lux. The only obvious clue that it's supposed to be Lux is the staff, an item that several other characters also have and isn't necessarily unique to Lux.

My biggest problem though is that her voice lines just don't really sound like Lux to me. She went from being upbeat, positive and carefree to being some edgy punmaster who's always biting at the bit to crack her next joke. Even though it's the same voice actor, that spirit from the original just isn't there.

Basically, I think Elementalist Lux is a fantastic skin; just not a good LUX skin. I know most people probably disagree with me, but I'm still probably going to end up swapping between this and my other Lux skins I already have, because her original persona is a big part of what draws me to her as a character, and it's something that's sadly missing from her new skin.

replies.body:
The goal here wasn't to give her base Lux's persona - with an ultimate skin, we're looking to change the alternate fantasy more so than we already do on all of our other skins; it's meant to be an experience. To your point of looking different, that's intended, she's meant to be older in this skin than she normally would be. Her goals aren't the same as base Lux. Keep in mind that skins aren't canon, and can (and usually do) veer away from a champion's base lore. 

I hope this explains the points you've brought up. If you have further questions, please let me know!
Think you meant most, since those cutpurse skins like Graves and TF are meant to be canon.

Correct, there are a few exceptions, but the general rule of thumb is that they are not, due to them being alternative fantasies, not the same champion in a costume change. Those particular skins were made for an event, which is why it was a pretty large exception from the norm of skins.
I have to ask, though, why Lux, in particular? Wouldn't Elementalist have made better sense on characters like Ryze, Syndra, or Xerath, all incredibly powerful mages?

As Mig89 mentioned, she does have the power to control light, so why not other types of magic/elements? We saw a lot of potential in the way she could transform and the way elements could be combined - she was the original champion we'd discussed when coming up with this idea.

 I do agree that the champions you've chosen could also make sense, although, I feel like Xerath, based on his existing skin catalog, may end up looking a bit more like chromas than an ultimate skin.

About Xerath, it would have been really cool if the sarcophagus (with shoulders and/or back pieces as in the GotS skin) and his body VFX would change according to the element. I think it would have made an even more badass effect than simply changing the dress and the haircut.

I respectfully disagree that Elementalist Lux is simply a skin with different outfits and hair. The obvious one is that she changes and combines forms to make new ones, but she has entirely new VO for each form, with some processing on some of the forms, custom VO interactions, new animations, new particles, new SFX, custom item shop VO - everything on her is new!

But he did not say entire skin is about different outfits and hair. He meant to say transform animation would look cooler on Xerath because his model has more effects and textures than Lux's. Elementalist Lux is by far the best ultimate skin ever for now, no doubt. But as Stars Shaper said, I think transformations would look cooler if It was Xerath.

Even though I think transformations would look better on Xerath, I don't think this skin theme fits to Xerath very well, since his the most generic skill, Q, has no travel time, which makes it pretty unlikely to use elements like Earth and Water. Even without it, skin themes like Dark Star and Cosmic Reaver are cooler and easier to make.

_Daily Reminding_

I'm always open to a 1820 RP Cosmic Reaver Xerath skin. <3

Plus 1350 RP Dark Star Xerath pls thx.

White/Cosmic Blue and Dark Purple, colors that you guys never used for Xerath!

Well my was an extreme semplification and it wasn't ment to underhestimate the work behind the skin, I find her extremely fascinating. Lux being a cheerful girl with a darker side and her maturing surely made her VO a lot interesting. But that's probably the only thing (coupled with the root effect) that Xerath missed compared to her, or am I missing something?

Anyway, I really like what the team has done, I find her the best skin out of everyone I saw until now and my only sad thought is that I'm never going to play Lux anyway xD

Cheers :)

>
> I respectfully disagree that Elementalist Lux is simply a skin with different outfits and hair. The obvious one is that she changes and combines forms to make new ones,  

That's not really THAT special, it's just classic elemental combination, Naruto began doing that years ago with stuff like earth+fire chakra makes lava or wind+water makes ice. You guys were a BIT lazy when you came up with stuff like Dark coming from opposing forces (technically darkness is the absence of light, but wouldn't Lux having two opposing forces just cancel her out back into Light form?) and Mystic not even being a proper "element" by any definition. 

>with some processing on some of the forms, custom VO interactions, new animations, 

But the thing is, compare how different Elementalist Lux is against Spirit Guard Udyr or DJ Sona. Udyr's ultimate is a borderline visual rework, and Sona's completely changes her feel and her behavior. Elementalist Lux looks more like a lot of 1350 skins put onto the same character with a vocal rework slapped onto them.

>new particles, 

Weren't some people pointing out that some particles are identical?

>new SFX

Arcade Ahri has entirely new SFX and that's a 1350 skin. That's not THAT big a deal.

>but she has entirely new VO for each form... custom item shop VO...

Those are just vocals. And honestly I was a bit underwhelmed with what you ended up going for with what you had the potential to do, it's just the now-standard "champ buys any item" lines (not even specific ones! I'd have loved to see stuff like Fire/Magma Lux getting excited at buying an offensive item item and Water/Nature Lux wanting more utility items), "champ kills enemy champ" lines, "champ kills class of champ" lines, "champ trashes tower" lines, "champ drops a ward" lines, where's some of the potential neat stuff like Lux's nature forms going into the jungle, fire/magma Lux applying a burn effect to enemies, water or ice Lux entering the river, any Lux managing to snipe an objective or champion, or just champion-specific taunts? It's not helped by the fact that a lot of Lux's lines are incredibly cringy puns. 

Vocals and sounds don't make a good skin, it's the things you do with them that does. Udyr was unique for his time in that his vocals reacted to clearing camps and built on each other depending on his form. DJ Sona doesn't even HAVE proper vocals but she changes the bgm for the match. Elementalist Lux's vocals are, honestly, a bit underwhelming and bring nothing new or exciting to the table. They're just advancements of things we already have.

And Mystic Lux is almost literally just Lulu in Lux's body. That was especially disappointing for me.

I haven't mentioned Pulsefire Ezreal at all because that's basically a Legendary Skin these days and nobody's denying it XD
Shes the one with the ability to copy any type of magic just by seeing it so it kinda makes sense shes can do this.

>can veer away from the champion's base lore

Ioania yasuo skin with crest thingy on his back like Irelia and karma then? :O

Well there's an old lore tidbit that Lux's upbeat and positive attitude is actually a mask to hide a crushingly empty shell of a person who has lost almost every chance to be someone other than the first daughter of the Crownguards. 

So I actually think it makes sense for her persona to switch so much with each element because of the influence the elements have over her own lack of identity. The power overwhelms her and she welcomes the primal force because it helps her feel alive. She's aware of it because one of her darkness lines is, "what have I become?!" Indicating that some transformation are going to far and further stripping away her individuality.

Lore-wise Elementalist Lux could be a fantastic way to explore how Lux lets her cheerfulness dissolve, and how one could bring out the Lux everyone loves - or at least, the real Lux, free of the First Daughter of the Crownguards mantle.

Actually it still is Lux.

Think about it. She sounds more mature becuase she is.

She is a prodigy mage that has been shown to be able to copy spells just be seeing them once, bend light to her whim and fashion her own spells.

After years of practice she could become a master of the elements themselves, not just light.

She has changes in those years. She no longer is as upbeat and happy as she once was. She has seen things.

She tries to fake emulate her old self, but it comes off as fake.

Her face looks nothing like normal Lux, as I mentioned if you compare the character icons for elementalist and the original they look like completely different people. She had plastic surgery? Also her new voice over is halfway filled with a bunch of jokes and puns, I never described her as sounding "more mature", I described her as sounding like an "edgy punmaster who's always biting at the bit to crack her next joke". I actually disagree, her new voice over doesn't sound mature to me. Less cheerful, but not more mature.

But she's still young in her base model. This skin is clearly at least five or six years in the future, so her face has probably aged as well. It does seem like she's trying to be her old self, but it could just be the character trying to seem like her past self. She's incredibly depressed in her lore, given her attitude in her league judgement (don't know if she still has that in her personality, now that the league is gone), and humor is how many people deal with depression.
I've read her new voice actor is the same voice actor. So if nothing else, that IS lux's aged voice.
I mean, it's kinda a new model.
A lot of skins, even cheap skins, have a very different persona than their base character. Rogue Admiral Garen is a pirate!
